Text:
This place I stumbled upon seems to be an ancient
facility where Malak the Malevolent was incubated
using some form of technology.

I'm shocked to learn that this dragon, rarely sighted
in the extreme east of Velgalta, is in fact an
artificial lifeform.

What's more, with this artifact, I can control Malak
with rational actions.

That means the key to undoing the seal on this
facility was furnished with a role suited to this
purpose.

As if that weren't enough, I discovered records of
experiments using Malak's flesh to enhance the human
body. The results indicate that sustained ingestion
of minute amounts can lead to a constant effect.

While the very idea of eating something that gives
off such a foul stench appalls me, for now I feel I
need to at least see if there is any truth to what
the records claim.

The proof is in the pudding, as they say, so I fed a
bandit I captured a large quantity of Malak flesh.

He refused to eat it at first, but eventually gave
in to his captivity-induced hunger and devoured
every last bit of it, to quite the dreadful result.

The man's body twisted to the point his physique
strained, horns grew from his forehead, and his skin
grew hard and dry like a dragon's scales. What
remained could hardly be called human.

This mere bandit of no importance was now a horrific
living weapon. I fought back when he attacked me,
but his strength and speed were astounding.

Though slightly taken aback, I observed him carefully,
and by the time I regained composure and cleaved the
creature in two with my blade, I was certain.

If I could make my own body accustomed to this power,
and if I could combine that with the artifact's control
over Malak...
...I may just be able to rule the world.

Eating even a small amount of Malak flesh made it
feel as if my insides were on fire and caused my
bones and jaw to begin to creak.

Something terrible is happening to my body.
It's entirely possible that there is no coming
back from this change.

However, the fact remains that my magic level shot up
rapidly, my bones and skin hardened, and my senses
are now sharper than before.

If I continue to train in my transformed state
against a Malak compelled to fight flawlessly by the
artifact, my skill with the sword will soar to new
heights.

Stan Bach of Velgalta's Seven Blades was never any
threat to me as a dark knight.

And yet, I sensed something from him that was oddly
unfathomable and unlike any normal member of our
calling.

Just as I have gained power by ingesting Malak
flesh in small doses, he, too, harbored some secret
aside from his skill with a sword.

This hunch of mine became a certainty thanks to an
invitation from a shadowy organization known as the
Cult of Diablos.

Without even knowing it, I had apparently slain one
of their leaders, the 10th seat of the Rounds.

The Knights of Rounds are the group within the Cult
who control the world from the shadows. And the
Tears of Diablos are what is said to assure they
will live forever.

But their Tear-extended lives are the very source of
the stagnation in this world.

Though I myself will be given Tears as the new 10th
seat of the Rounds, I have no intention of joining them
in their insipid lust for peace and calm.

No, I will fight fast and hard, as I always have.
I begin my preparations to take Velgalta in earnest.
...The records on this glowing panel end here.
The Tears of Diablos grant eternal life...?!
If that's true, the prospects are quite terrifying!

It would mean the Rounds have been controlling the
world for ages, unbound by conventional lifespans!

Not to mention that Sergey and Stan Bach weren't
First Children, but rather the 10th seats of the
Rounds...

I suppose that means the intel on the Cult that
No. 111, I mean Chi, gave us was partially inaccurate.

Not even families in long service to the Cult were
provided with factual informationâ€”we'll need to
crosscheck any new data we receive thoroughly
from now on.

We also need to find out more about the Tears of
Diablos. Although I find it hard to believe in the
idea of eternal life...!

Speaking of hard to believe! I can't believe that
sicko ate that stinky meat! So gross!

So that transformation Sergey underwent during his
fight with Master Shadow must've been him drawing
on Malak's power.

He concealed the physical changes with his armor and
visor. And if we consider his powers of regeneration
as also originating from Malak, it all makes sense.

...He stumbled upon the existence of a hidden power,
and since he possessed the means to control said
power, his ambitions swelled until they destroyed
him in the end... I guess?

So this was the truth behind why Malak's movements
seemed so strange. Honestly, though, this outcome
may be relevant to us all...

If I could wield the magic brought on by possession
but didn't have our lord to guide me...

I'm certain that I would've turned that power against
the world, hellbent on revenge... Just the thought of
it gives me chills.
That doesn't sound all that bad to me, really.
Zeta...

But I guess I wouldn't want to do it with power
that wasn't my own.

...Let's head further in. Search as you go, but stay
on guard.
And please refrain from touching anything else, Eta.
Aww...
You know better than that!
Hmph... Understood...

Strong! Strong! I want somebody strong and yummy to
show up!
